messages.subject: Re: Holocaust studies
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 07/12/1999 3:29:55 PM Eastern Daylight Time, Marbleface@aol.com writes:  ... Recently, my 11yo asked me
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 07/12/1999 3:29:55 PM Eastern Daylight Time,
Marbleface@... writes:

<<
<<
Thoughts...? Comments? >>

>>
Recently, my 11yo asked me about ethnic cleansing(with regards to Kosovo).
This led us into discussing lots of things:including our values, right and
wrong, differences. How lack of respect for differences can escalate,
conflict resolution etc. She asked about other times in history when people
did this to other people. This has been an ongoing discussion, initiated by
my dd.
My 7 yo left the room. She's not ready to talk about this stuff. But she
lives our values as part of our family.
Debra

messages.subject: Re: Holocaust studies
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 7/12/99 5:46:41 PM !!!First Boot!!!, KSeebose@aol.com writes:  My thought is that 7 is too young to really
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 7/12/99 5:46:41 PM !!!First Boot!!!, KSeebose@...
writes:

<<
Thoughts...? Comments? >>


My thought is that 7 is too young to really learn about the Holocaust. I
think it would just be scary without being informative. As important an area
as it is for everyone to know about, 7 is too young.

Except maybe as part of a discussion of freedoms we enjoy that people have
fought for, or something equally tame and positive.

Well, that's my 2 cents.

Nance
